# ðŸ—ºï¸ Interactive Maps with `leaflet`

In this tutorial, weâ€™ll explore how to create interactive web maps in R using the [`leaflet`](https://rstudio.github.io/leaflet/) package.

## ðŸ“¦ Load the `leaflet` package

```r
library(leaflet)
```

## ðŸŒ Create a basic map

This will show a map centered on San Francisco with a popup marker.

```r
leaflet() %>%
  addTiles() %>%  # Add default OpenStreetMap map tiles
  addMarkers(
    lng = -122.4194,
    lat = 37.7749,
    popup = "San Francisco, CA"
  )
```

## ðŸ§­ Customize with map styles and circles

Now weâ€™ll use a styled map and draw a red circle around a point.

```r
leaflet() %>%
  addProviderTiles("Stamen.TonerLite") %>%
  addCircles(
    lng = -122.4194,
    lat = 37.7749,
    radius = 500,
    color = "red",
    weight = 2,
    fillOpacity = 0.5,
    popup = "Downtown Area"
  )
```

You can explore other base maps using different `addProviderTiles()` options, like:

- `"CartoDB.Positron"`
- `"Esri.WorldImagery"`
- `"OpenTopoMap"`

## ðŸ§  Summary

- `leaflet()` initializes the map
- `addTiles()` or `addProviderTiles()` set the background map layer
- `addMarkers()` places clickable points
- `addCircles()` draws regions or focus areas

This is a powerful way to add spatial interactivity to your reports or Shiny apps.
